body: We want to use the same libtool style .so versions in both build systems, ideally both systems should read the version information from the same configuration file. This commit introduces an so.version configuration file and sets up the autotools to use it. The version numbers in so.version define the ABI compatibility and should be updated prior to each release. implements #323 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/420)

comment_regular_data.body: @cebe I tried adding your paste from https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/issues/323#issuecomment-271957371  to cmake/ModulePackage.cmake (I did adapt the file name to so.version), but somehow it did not work, so this pull request handles only the autotools part. Would be great if you could follow up with a pull request of your own to finalize it for cmake.

I reviewed it, looks fine to me, but I don't really know this stuff, so someone else can review and lgtm.

Should be, you can counter check with https://www.gnu.org/software/libtool/manual/libtool.html#Updating-version-info --- *[toxav/Makefile.inc, line 46 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/420#-KaH3a-yhLYAw-QJ5_Kj:-KaH8osDJv3u0oHHz9Ac:b-e69tfa) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/5a0750b6c08532dfa2d9ff9fcf9c67def6f36c42/toxav/Makefile.inc#L46)):*
Previously, GrayHatter (Gregory Mullen) wrote…
newlines instead of indentation?
Indenting "starting" lines does not work with automake, try indenting line 3 after the if BUILD_AV statement, you'll see that toxav won't be built any more, only indenting line continuations after a \ break is allowed; and of course the make syntax requires indentation in cases like... target: [TAB]shell_code ...but that's not the case here. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/420)*

commit.message:
Setup autotools to read .so version info from a separate file

We want to use the same libtool style .so versions in both build systems,
ideally both systems should read the version information from the same
configuration file.

This commit introduces an so.version configuration file and sets up
the autotools to use it.

The version numbers in so.version define the ABI compatibility and should be
updated prior to each release.

implements #323

SO versions for cmake and libtool

this updates the version-sync script to generate proper SO versions
which will be used by cmake and libtool to create version symlinks
on the system when a library is installed as well as setting the SO
version in the binary.

To see what this does, you have to configure tox with a prefix:

    ./configure --prefix=/tmp/tox-with-libtool
    mkdir cbuild && cd cbuild && cmake -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/tmp/tox-with-cmake ..

Then run `make && make install`.

in both instances you should see the following installed in `lib/`:

    libtoxcore.so -> libtoxcore.so.1.4.0
    libtoxcore.so.1 -> libtoxcore.so.1.4.0
    libtoxcore.so.1.4.0

inside the binary the soname should be the one with .1 and it should not
contain the full version:

    $ objdump -p libtoxcore.so.1.4.0 | grep SONAME
      SONAME               libtoxcore.so.1

title: Setup autotools to read .so version info from a separate file
